thread.title: Girls Soccer Roundup: Van Buren slips past C-R, 2-1
thread.title_full: Girls Soccer Roundup: Van Buren slips past C-R, 2-1

author: The Courier
title: Girls Soccer Roundup: Van Buren slips past C-R, 2-1
text:
Comment: 0 Van Buren’s Lisa Simmons (right) kicks the ball away from Cory-Rawson goalkeeper Hannah Bixler (36) and Faith Dearwester (25) in front of the goal during Saturday’s Division III district quarterfinal match. The three girls collided, went to the ground and Van Buren’s Grace Hoerig came in and scored the go-ahead goal to put the Black Knights up 2-1 with 2:24 left to play. (Photo by Matthias Leguire) 
VAN BUREN — Van Buren struck first on Saturday and squeaked by Cory-Rawson with a 2-1 win in Division III district quarterfinal girls soccer action. Van Buren (12-4-1) advances to play No. 1-seed Liberty-Benton at 5 p.m. Wednesday in a district semifinal at Findlay High School. Gabbi McCracken and Grace Hoerig scored for the Black Knights, while Marly McCartney made four saves. Hayley Waltz scored the Hornets’ lone goal as they fell to 9-6-3 to end their season. goals: (CR) Hayley Waltz 1, (VB) Gabbi McCracken 1, Grace Hoerig 1. Assists: (CR) Katie Brown 1. shots-on-goal: Van Buren 9-5. saves: (CR) Hannah Bixler 7, (VB) Marly McCartney 4. records: Cory-Rawson 9-6-3; Van Buren 12-4-1. 
LIBERTY-BENTON 1 BLUFFTON 0 FINDLAY — Sydney Barton used a Leah Recker pass to score the game’s only goal as Liberty-Benton shut out Bluffton 1-0 in a Division III district quarterfinal girls soccer match on Saturday. Liberty-Benton (13-3-1) advances to play Van Buren at 5 p.m. Wednesday at Findlay High School. The Eagles had a 13-1 shots-on-goal advantage. Taylor Garlock made one save for L-B, while Jadyn Barhorst made 12 saves for Bluffton (6-11-1). goals: (LB) Sydney Barton 1. Assists: (LB) Leah Recker 1. shots-on-goal: Liberty-Benton 13-1. saves: (Blu) Jadyn Barhorst 12, (LB) Taylor Garlock 1. records: Bluffton 6-11-1, Liberty-Benton 13-3-1. 
RIVERDALE 5 MANSFIELD CHRISTIAN 1 MOUNT BLANCHARD — Gabi Rodriguez and Aubreah Manns each scored twice as Riverdale ousted Mansfield Christian 5-1 in a Division III district quarterfinal girls soccer match on Saturday. Riverdale improved to 12-4-1 and advances to play Ashland Crestview in a district semifinal at 7 p.m. Wednesday at Findlay High School. Taylor Frey added a goal and an assist for the Falcons, while Jenna Livingston made two saves. 
goals: (Riv) Gabi Rodriguez 2, Aubreah Manns 2, Taylor Frey 1. Assists: (Riv) Kelsay Martin 1, Lexie Wright 1, Hannah Morris 1, Lexi Bahn 1, Frey 1. shots-on-goal: Riverdale 13-3. saves: (Riv) Jenna Livingston 2. records: Riverdale 12-4-1. 
KALIDA 3 LIBERTY CENTER 0 KALIDA — Brittany Kahle, Paige Roller and Makenna Richey scored for Kalida as the Wildcats shut out Liberty Center 3-0 in a Division III district quarterfinal girls soccer match on Saturday. Kalida (10-5-2) advances to take on host Ottoville in a district semifinal on Wednesday at 7 p.m. Layne Laudick had an assist for Kalida, which had a 15-0 shots-on-goal advantage. Libby Ball stopped 12 shots in goal for Liberty Center (8-8-2). 
goals: (Kal) Brittany Kahle, Paige Roller & Makenna Richey 1. Assists: (Kal) Layne Laudick 1. shots-on-goal: Liberty Center 0, Kalida 15. saves: (LC) Libby Ball 12. records: Liberty Center 8-8-2; Kalida 10-5-2. 
COLDWATER 1 MILLER CITY 0 COLDWATER — Maura Hoying scored off a pass from Lexi Depweg in the first half to give Coldwater a 1-0 win over Miller City in a Division III district quarterfinal match on Saturday. Coldwater (8-8-1) advances to take on No. 1 seed Delphos Jefferson (13-0-4) at 5 p.m. Wednesday at Ottoville. Miller City (7-8-3) outshot Coldwater 6-5. Amanda Simon had three saves for the Wildcats, while Brittany Muhlenkamp had six saves to earn the shutout for Coldwater. 
OTTOVILLE 2 FORT JENNINGS 1 FORT JENNINGS — Four-seed Fort Jennings was knocked off by 6-seed Ottoville 2-1 on Saturday in an eventual penalty kick decision in a Division III district quarterfinal girls soccer match. FJ and Ottoville finished one overtime period and one set of penalty kicks before the Big Green (9-9) ended the game — and Fort Jennings’ (6-11) season — in the second set of PK’s with their seventh kicker. Ottoville advances to play 2-seed Kalida at 7 p.m. Wednesday at Ottoville High School.
